item.title: Making a new .java Server File
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

public class LoginChecker { public LoginChecker(Player p) { if (!p.playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { p.disconnected = true; System.out.println("loginChecker Terminated..."); } } }

Than you would add something like

LoginChecker(this);

in class Player.

Read full topic

item.title: Making a new .java Server File
item.dc:creator: @pure2ownage Pure_
item.description:
@pure2ownage wrote:

Hey guys I’ve recently tried to make a .java file for my Server. One like “Client.java” but instead mine disconnects syipkpker’s. I was going to make it better but i come accross a problem. Can anyone figure it out?

[code=java]import java.util.*;
import java.io.File;
import java.io.FileInputStream;
import java.io.PrintWriter;
import java.io.BufferedReader;
import java.io.BufferedWriter;
import java.io.FileReader;
import java.io.FileWriter;
import java.util.ArrayList;

public class loginChecker {

	if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) {
		disconnected = true;
                                                  System.out.println("loginChecker Terminated...");
	}

}[/code]

my Compiler:-

.\autobanner.java:15: illegal start of type if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ .\autobanner.java:15: illegal start of type if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ .\autobanner.java:15: ')' expected if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ .\autobanner.java:15: ';' expected if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ .\autobanner.java:15: invalid method declaration; return type required if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ .\autobanner.java:15: illegal start of type if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ .\autobanner.java:15: ';' expected if (!playerName.contains("syipkpker")) { ^ 7 errors Press any key to continue . . .

Read full topic
